content.body: jschoi: in a proposal, or in the spec?
content.formatted_body: jschoi: in a proposal, or in the spec?

content.body: must be a proposal, if there's an <emu-grammar> on line 138

jschoi: that warning is designed for the full spec, where the full grammar is available; I guess I did not properly disable it in proposals. so the problem is that ecmarkup does not know about that production because the proposal doesn't define it. I'll fix the suppression at some point; in the mean time, just ignore the warning, it'll still build
content.formatted_body: jschoi: that warning is designed for the full spec, where the full grammar is available; I guess I did not properly disable it in proposals. so the problem is that ecmarkup does not know about that production because the proposal doesn't define it. I'll fix the suppression at some point; in the mean time, just ignore the warning, it'll still build

content.body: So there isn't a way for a proposal doc to include/import definitions from the spec?
at some point I mean to put that sort of thing into the biblio and also make the bilio updatable, but I haven't done so yet
But there's a 'biblio' file? what does that do?
